title: parameter and return value sections in func/method documentation
body:
by **per.arneng**: 
It is much easier to read API documentation that is well formated and has
easier access to areas you frequently are interested in. Javadoc makes it
possible to specify documentation on the parameters and returnvalues. This
makes it very easy to find that specific information. Python for example
does not have this and you have to read through the whole text just to find
specifics about the return value. 

The .NET framework documentation, Monodoc and the Javadoc are examples of
great API documentations and they allow documentation on specific parts of
a method.

Referenses:

Javadoc example:
http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/io/PrintStream.html#printf(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.Object...)

Example from ms.net:
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.console.writeline(VS.80).aspx
